content:
I’m a PhD student in the Computer Vision and Geometry Group at ETH Zurich under the supervision of Prof. Marc Pollefeys.
I obtained both my BSc in Computer Science and MSc in Robotics, Systems and Control from ETH Zurich and spent a semester at KTH in Stockholm. I also spent some time at Volkswagen Group Research, the Microsoft Mixed Reality & AI Lab, and Meta Reality Labs as an intern.
summary:
I’m a PhD student in the Computer Vision and Geometry Group at ETH Zurich under the supervision of Prof. Marc Pollefeys.
I obtained both my BSc in Computer Science and MSc in Robotics, Systems and Control from ETH Zurich and spent a semester at KTH in Stockholm.
title: Marcel Geppert

summary: We propose a partial localization approach for cloud-based visual localization. By applying geometric lifting to the map we prevent the server from knowing the exact client pose. Still, the client can locally combine multiple partial queries into a full pose.
title: Privacy Preserving Partial Localization

summary: We present privacy preserving localization and mapping without the need for calibrated cameras.
title: Privacy Preserving Localization and Mapping from Uncalibrated Cameras

summary: A method for automatic camera rig calibration based on a prebuilt model of the environment.
title: Infrastructure-based Multi-Camera Calibration using Radial Projections

summary: We present the first full Structure-from-Motion pipeline from privacy preserving line features.
title: Privacy Preserving Structure-from-Motion

summary: A novel, dynamic feature matching and pose estimation strategy tailored to multi-camera systems.
title: Efficient 2D-3D Matching for Multi-Camera Visual Localization

summary: A project to develop visual perception systems for autonomous driving in difficult environments.
title: Project AutoVision: Localization and 3D Scene Perception for an Autonomous Vehicle with a Multi-Camera System
Towards Robust Visual Odometry with a Multi-Camera System
